page.title: 11Harvest in Stambourne
page.content: Harvest is a very busy time in Stam_ bourne and Toppesfield.This area is good farmland,mainly rich boulder clay.Cereals,potatoes,peas and oilseed rape are grown widely.The patchwork of colours in the fields is dominated in early summer by the brilliant yellow of the rape.As the fields turn golden brown,harvest begins with two or even three combine harvesters working in a field.Moving these huge machines along narrow lanes is difficult and roads usually have to be cleared in advance to allow them to pass. Stubble and discarded straw in the fields is often burnt but many people criticise this because smoke and smuts create a mess in people's homes.Toppesfield School and local Churches hold Thanksgiving Services and children traditionally take gifts of harvest produce to elderly and sick people.
